title: Gupta Perioperative Risk for Myocardial Infarction or Cardiac Arrest (MICA)
description: Predicts risk of myocardial infarction or cardiac arrest within 30 days after surgery using five validated perioperative risk factors

parameters.name: functional_status
parameters.description: Functional status assessment based on activities of daily living

parameters.name: asa_class
parameters.description: American Society of Anesthesiologists Physical Status Classification

parameters.name: surgery_type
parameters.description: Type of surgical procedure being performed

result.name: cardiac_risk_percentage
result.description: Predicted risk of myocardial infarction or cardiac arrest within 30 days

ranges.interpretation: Very low risk of perioperative cardiac events. Standard perioperative monitoring appropriate. Consider routine postoperative care protocols.
Low risk of perioperative cardiac events. Standard monitoring with attention to cardiac symptoms. Consider basic cardiac precautions.
Moderate risk requiring enhanced monitoring. Consider cardiac telemetry, serial troponins, and cardiology consultation for high-risk procedures.
High risk requiring intensive monitoring and cardiac optimization. Strongly consider preoperative cardiology evaluation, continuous cardiac monitoring, and postoperative ICU care.

Very high risk requiring comprehensive cardiac evaluation and optimization. Consider postponing elective surgery for cardiac optimization, preoperative stress testing, and multidisciplinary team approach.

references: Gupta PK, Gupta H, Sundaram A, et al. Development and validation of a risk calculator for prediction of cardiac risk after surgery. Circulation. 2011;124(4):381-387. doi: 10.1161/CIRCULATIONAHA.110.015701

Bilimoria KY, Liu Y, Paruch JL, et al. Development and evaluation of the universal ACS NSQIP surgical risk calculator: a decision aid and informed consent tool for patients and surgeons. J Am Coll Surg. 2013;217(5):833-842. doi: 10.1016/j.jamcollsurg.2013.07.385

Ford MK, Beattie WS, Wijeysundera DN. Systematic review: prediction of perioperative cardiac complications and mortality by the revised cardiac risk index. Ann Intern Med. 2010;152(1):26-35. doi: 10.7326/0003-4819-152-1-201001050-00007
formula: Cardiac risk (%) = e^x / (1 + e^x), where x = -5.25 + (age Ã— 0.02) + functional_status_points + asa_class_points + creatinine_points + surgery_type_points
notes: Developed from >400,000 patients in the American College of Surgeons National Surgical Quality Improvement Program database
Superior predictive ability (C-statistic 0.88) compared to Revised Cardiac Risk Index (C-statistic 0.75)
Predicts 30-day perioperative myocardial infarction or cardiac arrest risk
Applies to both cardiac and non-cardiac surgical procedures
Should be used in conjunction with clinical judgment and not as absolute predictor
Does not include stress test results, echocardiography findings, or beta-blocker therapy status
May underestimate risk in patients with known coronary artery disease not captured in variables
Useful for preoperative counseling, risk stratification, and postoperative monitoring decisions
High-risk patients (>1-2%) may benefit from enhanced perioperative monitoring and cardiology consultation
